doc.field: Jake Green National Maritime Union Photographs
Jake Green National Maritime Union Photographs

The following eight 8x10 b&w photographs: - Top National Maritime Union Leaders (Unity Conference 3/30/46), L to R: Josh Lawrence, Ferdinand Smith (National Secretary), Revels Cayton (of International Longshoremen's and Warehouse Union) - Credential Committee (Eddie Gordon, far left) - 1947 NMU Credential Committee. (Eddie Gordon fourth from left, Stanley Postek, 2nd from right. - Captain Mulzac and company officials.) - Launching SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943. - Launching of SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943. (Center, 4th from the left, James Drury, NMU Port Agent, Baltimore, with company representative. Ferdinand Smith, captain? 3rd mate - John.) - Image of a mural (?) of a man crushing a Nazi U-boat and towing ships behind him. - Men standing on a stage, holding up letters that spell out part of "Support President Roosevelt" with same mural of man crushing a Nazi u-boat in background

(Eddie Gordon fourth from left, Stanley Postek, 2nd from right. - Captain Mulzac and company officials.) - Launching SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943. - Launching of SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943.
